issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Example run here: https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/actions/runs/1098292848

The job seems to be killed for some reason ("exited with a non-zero exit code -9").
The same test run works fine locally (using {{archery docker run conda-cpp-valgrind}}), so perhaps this is caused by some Github Actions restriction.

comments.body: I can think of a OOM error. How much memory valgrand is supposed consume? Perhaps we should try to decrease the ctest parallelism.
This is not during Valgrind, this is during compilation.
That said, this build has some compiler optimizations enabled, and perhaps they are taking a bit too much memory...
The rest of the conda builds are not failing though.
{{-Og}} is only enabled on the Valgrind build, so that may be the explanation still.
